author: Staff Reporter
text:
Three persons, including the conductor of a Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) bus, died on the spot after the bus rammed a sand-laden lorry near Gajalnaickenpatty on Madurai-Bengaluru National Highway here on Saturday.

The incident took place at 5.30 a.m. when the Salem-bound bus from Tiruchi with 25 passengers was nearing Nalikalpatti-Panamarathupatty junction, failed to notice a lorry, which had been parked along the highway, hit the rear of the vehicle.

Kumar (46) of Veeraganur in Attur was at the wheel of the bus, while Kumar (45) of Pethanaickenpalayam was the conductor.

In the impact, the right side of the bus was completely ripped apart, resulting in the death of conductor Kumar, Venkatesh (36) and Lewis (35) of L.R. Nagar in Koramangala, Karnataka.

Injured

The driver and four other passengers were seriously injured and were admitted to Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital.

Mallur police have registered a case.
title: Three killed as bus rams lorry
